body.p:
IN THE NAME AND BY THE AUTHORITY OF THE
COMMONWEALTH OF KENTUCKY,
BERIAH MAGOFFIN,
GOVERNOR OF SAID COMMONWEALTH,
KENTUCKY
UNITED WE STAND DIVIDED WE FALL
To all who shall see these Presents, Greeting:

Know Ye, That Nat. Gaither Jr having been duly elected appointed Secretary of State for the Commonwealth of Kentucky in the place of Tho. B. Monroe Jr. resigned I hereby invest him with full power and authority to execute and discharge the duties of the said office according to law: And to have and to hold the same, with all the rights and emoluments thereunto legally appertaining, for and during the term prescribed by law.

In Testimony Whereof, I have caused these letters to be made patent, and the Seal of the Commonwealth to be hereunto affixed. Done at Frankfort, the 2nd day of Octo, in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and Sixty one, and in the 70th year of the Commonwealth.

body.p:
BY THE GOVERNOR:
, Secretary of State.
"Yeoman" Office -- J. B. MAJOR, State Printer.

State of Kentucky
Franklin County Sct

I George W Gwin a Justice of the peace for said County do certify that Nat Gaither this day came personally before me and took the oath prescribed in the first Section of the Eighth Article of the Constitution of Kentucky for the faithful discharge of the duties of Secretary of State for the Commonwealth of Kentucky under the within Commission
Given under my hand this 2nd day of October 1861

Secretary of State
Nat: Gaither Jr
Appd. & Comd
Octo. 2nd 1861
